cards.flavor_text: [i]Sometimes strange and unknown bones are misidentified out of sheer lack of familiarity. And sometimes it's done for profit.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{W}{U} EXILE Ponder the infinite sky and track what has been exiled beyond our world. [i](That creature can't be blocked except by three or more creature or by creatures with beyond.)[/i]
{U}{B} STRANGE I want to believe, and with powerful Strange spells, you will too.
{B}{R} FOLKLORE Remember those who came before you with Folklore spells.
{R}{G} HOMESTEAD Use your bigger creatures to carve out a homestead and cast discounted spells.
{G}{W} HOMESTEAD Let many work and one and cast homestead spells with multiple creatures.
{W}{B} COUNTERS Life is hard on the frontier. Build your resilience with +1/+1 counters.
{B}{G} STRANGE Cryptic cryptids and mysterious monsters are your path to victory.
{G}{U} SIGHTINGS Chase half-seen visions of the strange and paranormal.
{U}{R} FOLKLORE Cast Folklore spells to remember the history of San Xalco
{R}{W} RANGERS Gather a posse and circle the wagons; your Ranger creatures will protect the settlement.

[+1]: Create a 1/1 white Human Ranger creature token.

cards.flavor_text: [i]Beneath the sand and the endless skies of San Xalco lie the remnants of the long dead civilization that shaped the plane. Their work is unknown to modern settlers, but their bones are not.[/i]
[i]The plane of San Xalco brings people to its empty vastness, reaching out through the multiverse to pluck the unsafe and the needy from their home planes to settle and safeguard it.[/i]

[i]Mana leylines on San Xalco are weak, often leaving its settlers dependent on means other than magic. They believe the plane has been drained, not realizing that it uses its own power to protect itself from intruders.[/i]

[i]The horizon on San Xalco is always just out of reach; its skies truly endless. Ancient magic cast by its first civilization ensured its skies would be forever safe from outsiders, but unknowingly doomed it to lonely isolation.[/i]

[i]San Xalco is riddled with ancient bones—of dinosaurs and of civilization. Not all its inhabitants believe the stories and sightings of strange entities on its dark fringes, and turn their studies instead to these buried clues.[/i]
